MajorClaims.Text: you should focus on what you are good at
doing what you can already do well helps you make a big accomplishment and do it much better

Claims.Text: you will be more likely to accomplish your purpose by concentrating on what you do well
by doing what you are good at, you will be better at it

Premises.Text: the more time you spend on what you do well, the more likely to achieve something great you will be
Albert Einstein, one of the most competent physicians in history, devoted most of his life to develop theory in physics and finally established special and general relativity
he hardly cared about something else
It is said that, surprisingly, he never tried to distinguish a hand soup and a facial soup
using two different soups properly was quite annoying
Focusing what you are good at helps you attain your goal
When you're doing something well, you will feel more satisfied and more interested in it
you will motivate yourself to do more
I used to be good at math when I was in junior high school
I was really satisfied with the fact that I could do preferably
I became to absorb myself to try more advanced level of math problems
I could not only get higher scores in math test but also solve the university-level problems
If you keep doing what you already do well, you can be better good at it
